problem_text: Determine the structure of infinite 2-transitive permutation groups (G, Ω) in which the stabilizer of a point α ∈ Ω has the form Gα = A · Gαβ where Gαβ is the stabilizer of two points α, β, α ̸= β, such that Gαβ contains an element inverting the subgroup A. Suppose, in particular, that A \ {1} contains at most two conjugacy classes of Gα; does G then possess a normal subgroup isomorphic to PSL2 over a field? A. N. Fomin
